meanings.sent1: The storm was havocking the small town, leaving nothing but ruins.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was havocking the entire city, destroying buildings and roads.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was havocking the picnic area by knocking over all the trash cans.
meanings.sent4: The virus was havocking the computer system, corrupting files and data.
meanings.sent5: The fire was havocking through the forest, consuming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: The act of causing chaos or disorder.
meanings.sent1: The havocking of the party started when the cake was accidentally dropped on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The havocking of the classroom ensued when the students started throwing paper airplanes.
meanings.sent3: The havocking of the office was caused by the misplaced stapler that led to a frenzy of searching.
meanings.sent4: The havocking of the garden was evident with overturned pots and scattered tools.
meanings.sent5: The havocking of the schedule occurred when the meeting times were all mixed up.

meanings.sent1: The children were havocking the sandcastle they had built, laughing mischievously.
meanings.sent2: The vandals were havocking the park benches, leaving them broken and damaged.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was havocking the living room, chewing on shoes and pillows.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were havocking the streets, shouting slogans and causing unrest.
meanings.sent5: The monkeys were havocking the fruit stand, grabbing and throwing bananas everywhere.
